intro: Piper yaxhanum, commonly known as the Yaxhán pepper, is a flowering plant native to the humid lowlands of Central America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species such as black pepper and chili peppers. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, with slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, round berries that are typically green when mature. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
